item.title: Bangladesh to open embassies in Dublin and Buenos Aires
item.description: The Council of Advisers has approved a proposal from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to establish two new embassies, one in Dublin, Ireland, and the other in Buenos Aires, Argentina. The decision was taken at the 48th meeting of the Council of Advisers, presided over by Chief Adviser Professor Muh

item.title: Nurul Kabir new president, Hanif secretary of Editors’ Council
item.description: New Age Editor Nurul Kabir has been elected the president and Bonik Barta Editor Dewan Hanif Mahmud the general secretary of Editors’ Council for a two-year term. The election of the new executive committee of the council, a forum of editors of national newspapers, was held on Thursday in th

item.title: Ex-mayor Khokon faces money laundering charges
item.description: ACC Deputy Director Mostafizur Rahman lodged the case at the Integrated District Office, Dhaka. He said the commission approved the action after receiving allegations of money laundering and reviewing the preliminary evidence from its investigation. According to the chargesheet, Khokon and Shahan

item.title: Dismembered body found in plastic drum near National Eidgah in Dhaka
item.description: Police have recovered a dismembered body from the footpath adjacent to the National Eidgah ground in the capital on Thursday afternoon. Shahbagh Police Station Officer-in-Charge (OC) Khalid Mansur said that two plastic drums were thrown on the footpath next to the water pump at the National Eidgah

item.title: Canada eyes fresh start in trade talks with India, says minister Sidhu
item.description: Canada and India are working to rebuild trade ties and explore new areas of cooperation after a two-year chill, with Ottawa keen to restart trade negotiations under “a new process”, Canadian Trade Minister Maninder Sidhu said on Thursday. Sidhu, on a three-day visit to India, met Comme

item.title: Philippine political veteran Juan Ponce Enrile, key Marcos Sr-era figure, dies at 101
item.description: Juan Ponce Enrile, one of the most enduring and polarising figures in Philippine politics, who played a central role during the rule of the late Philippine strongman Ferdinand Marcos Sr, died on Thursday at the age of 101, his daughter said. Enrile’s death ends a political career spanning mo

item.title: Judge’s son killed, wife injured in Rajshahi knife attack
item.description: A shocking tragedy unfolded in Rajshahi city on Thursday as the 18-year-old son of a sitting judge was hacked to death and his wife severely injured in a violent attack at their rented residence in the city’s Dabtola area. The victim, Tausif Rahman Sumon, a class IX student, was the son of R

item.title: Dengue: 3 more die, 833 hospitalised in 24 hours
item.description: The dengue situation in Bangladesh continues to deteriorate, with three more deaths and 833 new hospitalisations reported across the country in the 24 hours till Thursday morning. According to the Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS), the latest figures bring this year’s total death

item.title: Buddhists highest religious leader Dr Jnanasree Mahathero passes away
item.description: Highest religious leader of Bangladeshi Buddhists and Ekushey Award winner, the Supreme Patriarch of Sangha Council of Bangladesh (monastic order) Aggamahapandita Dr Jnanasree Mahathero passed away at a city hospital on Thursday. He was around 101, hospital and monastery, sources said

item.title: 100,000 yaba sseized from abandoned private car in Ctg
item.description: Police in Chittagong have recovered about 100,000 yaba tablets worth an estimated Tk 30 million from an abandoned private car in the Firingi Bazar area under Kotwali police station. The operation took place on Thursday around 6:30 p.m. near the old Fishery Ghat area, according to OC Abdul Karim of

item.title: BNP thanks CA for reaffirming Feb election
item.description: BNP on Thursday thanked the Chief Adviser for reaffirming that the next national election will be held in the first half of February and for announcing that a referendum will take place on the same day. “The BNP Standing Committee, chaired by Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman, thanked the Chief

item.title: 9 districts get new deputy commissioners
item.description: The interim government has carried out another phase of reshuffles, appointing new deputy commissioners (DCs) in nine districts ahead of the general election. With the latest move, a total of 38 DCs have now been transferred, reports bdnews24.com. A notification from the Ministry of Public Admini
